data.name: Pale Ale
data.description: This highly hopped California style Pale Ale showcases the brewer's art of balancing malt and hop characteristics. A generous addition of Munich malts balances the bittering from Chinook hops, and Cascade hops round out the flavor profile.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: American-Style Pale Ale
style.description: American pale ales range from deep golden to copper in color. The style is characterized by fruity, floral and citrus-like American-variety hop character producing medium to medium-high hop bitterness, flavor, and aroma. Note that the "traditional" style of this beer has its origins with certain floral, fruity, citrus-like, piney, resinous, or sulfur-like American hop varietals. One or more of these hop characters is the perceived end, but the perceived hop characters may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. American pale ales have medium body and low to medium maltiness. Low caramel character is allowable. Fruity-ester flavor and aroma should be moderate to strong. Diacetyl should be absent or present at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

breweries.name: Lost Coast Brewery
breweries.description: Founded in 1989 by Barbara Groom, the Lost Coast Brewery is one of the only female-owned and operated breweries in the U.S. Lost Coast is famous for its delicious and award-winning beers: Great White, Downtown Brown, Indica IPA & Tangerine Wheat!

data.name: Pale Ale
data.description: This Pale pours a deep golden color with an off white head. A citrus and tropical aroma precede a medium-light body full of fruity goodness. Hints of tangerine and guava with a drinkable malt profile.

breweries.name: Dangerous Man Brewing Company
breweries.description: Dangerous Man Brewing Company’s mission is to be a destination tap house brewery in Minneapolis, focusing on high-quality small-batch production beers. With ever-changing taps, we will be the hub for lovers of beer and those seeking everything from the traditional to the extreme in their glass.

data.name: Pale Ale
data.description:
Our flagship beer. Dark golden hue. Husky grain aromas with floral hop accents.
Silver medal winner, 1998; World Beer Championships.

breweries.name: Hinterland Brewery
breweries.description: Hinterland is a small artisinal brewery devoted to brewing world class beer. Founded in 1995, by Bill & Michelle Tressler, Hinterland makes it's home in a turn of the century meat packing warehouse. Our award-winning beer can be found throughout Wisconsin's finest restaurants, taverns, grocery stores or anywhere craft beer is sold.In addition, Hinterland beer is served at our restaurant attached to the brewery in Green Bay as well as Hinterland Erie Street Gastropub in Milwaukee's Third Ward District and at our affiliated restaurant The Whistling Swan Inn & Restaurant in Fish Creek, WI.

breweries.name: Caldera Brewing
breweries.description:
Caldera Brewing Company was incorporated March 12, 1996. The first brew was July 4, 1997 and the first keg sold was August 28, 1997. Caldera self-distributed its products for the first six years. In November 2003, Caldera partnered up with Gold River Distributing in Southern Oregon and Mt. Hood Beverage Company in the Eugene and Portland markets to expand its business. Please see the Distribution page for current distribution.

For the first eight years, Caldera was draught only until June 2005 when the Pale Ale was put into cans. Caldera is the first microbrewery in the State of Oregon to brew and can its own beer. See The Aluminum Beer Can page for more on cans and the quality they provide.

breweries.name: FATE Brewing Company
breweries.description: FATE Brewing Company is Boulder’s first brew-bistro and your new place to enjoy chef-inspired, gourmet creations with unique, handcrafted microbrews. Local ingredients are featured on the lunch, brunch, and dinner menus and the full bar with 30 taps feature house drafts and rotating guest beer. Stop by for a pint and a bite at 1600 38th Street and Arapahoe Road (one block west of Foothills Parkway) in Boulder, Colorado.

breweries.name: Bacchus Brewing Company
breweries.description: At Bacchus Brewing Company, we start each day with a singular focus. We love what we do and want to provide you with only the highest quality beer. Every beer we produce is made with premium ingredients and attention to detail. The quality of our beer reflects who we are and what we care about. We encourage you to sit back, relax, and enjoy an exceptional taste of the Finger Lakes. Visit us in person or at www.bacchusbrewing.com.

breweries.name: Stallhagen
breweries.description:
Microbrewery Stallhagen Ab was set up in 2004 by a group of beer enthusiasts. It currently has over 1600 shareholders. The first brewery on the Åland islands was established back in the 1850's, but Stallhagen is now Åland's only brewery, with a production site at Grelsby, 18 km from Mariehamn.

The initial aim of the brewery was to produce good craft beers, mainly for the Åland market. However, with its flavorful products the company has quickly won innumerable friends outside Åland, and Stallhagen beer is now sold in both Finland and Sweden. Steadily increasing demand and investments in higher production capacity have led to a growth in sales volumes and made the Stallhagen brand well-known to beer-lovers generally, not just the growing flock of experts and connoisseurs.

data.description: From Chico to San Diago, for us California is the home of the classic American Pale Ale. Cascade in our hopback combined with balanced malts make this a true West Coast sessionable style beer.

breweries.name: Fourpure Brewing Co.
breweries.description: Fourpure is a London based family brewery founded in 2013. Beer is our passion and our travels are what inspire us to brew. Our approach to exceptional brewing is all about attention to detail, not cutting corners and innovating yet staying true to the principles of brewing – respecting the four core ingredients used to make beer: grain, yeast, hops and water. This was the inspiration for the name Fourpure.

data.name: Pale Ale
data.description: Our lightest beer, the Pale Ale is well balanced with traditional and crystal malts, the appearance is slightly hazy – golden amber color.It is fruity and estery with the crystal malt providing a bit of residual sweetness.It is moderately hopped with two additions of German Hallertau hops.

breweries.name: Railhouse Brewery
breweries.description:
Raihouse Brewery was officially founded Dec 1, 2010, in the historic town of Aberdeen, North Carolina. Started by military veterans Brian Evitts (U.S. Navy), and Mike Ratkowski (U.S. Army). They met as managers of the same company and were drawn together by the same home brewing passion to make excellent beers. Brian has been an avid home brewer for almost 15 years, while Mike has always enjoyed the culture of breweries. They both felt there was a lack of their style of beer--beer focused on the malted barley and not so focused on the hops.

Railhouse Brewery currently offers seasonal and year-round beers, including the following: Mastiff Oatmeal Stout, KA-BAR Brown Ale, FCA IPA, Vanilla Porter, Barleywine, and Pale Ale. The brewery and pub is located at 105 East South Street, Aberdeen, NC.

breweries.name: Crabby Larry's Brewpub Steak & Crab House
breweries.nameShortDisplay: Crabby Larry's Brewpub Steak & Crab House
breweries.description:
In 1990 Larry came up with the idea to sell produce from the corner of Rt. 463 and Lower State Road. He took Dani and the three kids to meet the owner of the property, Al Walters. Mr. Walters took an immediate liking to the Jones family and allowed Dani and Larry to sell produce from his corner. Being a farmer, he even started growing corn and other vegetables for them. One day, Larry's father showed up with a bushel of live crabs and left them with Dani to sell. The crabs sold so fast that they picked up more crabs, shrimp, and other types of seafood too. In 1994, Mr. Walters passed away and Dani and Larry had to move on to bigger and better things. They rented a space in the Chalfont Village Shopping Center and opened a restaurant and fresh fish market. Dani and Larry did all the cooking. Larry would go to the fish market daily to ensure the freshest seafood. And with the help of loyal family and friends, Jones Family Seafood became a popular seafood restaurant in the area.
    Early in 2001, Larry received a mailing, the kind we all ignore, advertising "Brew your own beer". He was immediately hooked. After convincing Dani that this was a good idea, they met up with a "brew master", ordered the equipment, and they were on their way.

breweries.name: Little Creatures Brewery
breweries.description:
After many trials and experimentations, our first beer, Little Creatures Pale Ale, was proudly presented to the Australian market just in time for the summer of 2001.

Throughout the years, we’ve created a little family of beers that we brew today with the same enthusiasm and drive as the day we began. And while we continue to grow and stretch our horizons, we are still excited by and are motivated to make better beer with greater consistency each and every day.

We welcome you to share our passion for great beer, where ever you are.

data.name: Pale Ale
data.description: Our flagship Pale Ale, released in 1998, is brewed with specialty malts, some grown in Maine, and four types of hops. After fermentation, it is cold conditioned and dry-hopped in lagering tanks for maximum taste and quality. It is naturally carbonated in the bottle or keg using a German process called “krausening”, where a small amount of fresh fermenting wort is added. This produces a delicate carbonation and superior flavor. From the Mash Tun to store shelves is a 30 day process.

The Mount Washington Valley of NH's Local Brew. Offering four hand-crafted brews. Available in stores and restuarants in NH, MA & ME.

Tuckerman Brewing Co. brews our beer in the most green manner possible, using as many local ingredients and packaging materials as possible.

In 1998, Tuckerman Brewing Co. was founded with a love of the White Mountains of NH, in particular Mount Washington and the desire to create a fine hand crafted beer

breweries.name: Laughing Dog Brewing
breweries.description: At Laughing Dog Brewing, what began with a dream for brews with more hops has turned into an insatiable desire to craft beers of all flavors, with a focus on quality, purity, and fun. Today, Laughing Dog brews has brewed over 15 distinct beers, including seasonals like our Huckleberry Ale and Winter Ale, and our award-winning IPA's and Stouts. But despite our success and growth, our motto remains the same as the day we started, to create... "Fetchingly Good Beer"!

data.name: Pale Ale
data.description: This well-balanced American style pale ale has an English, German & Belgium influences to create an interesting blend of flavors. The hops have a crisp citrus bitterness with an herbal citrus aroma and flavor. The flavor is clean rich and malty with a hint of caramel in the finish.

breweries.name: High Point Wheat Beer Company
breweries.description:
High Point Brewing Company was founded in 1996 as the first exclusive wheat beer brewery in America. The founder and driving force of High Point is award-winning homebrewer, Greg Zaccardi. After working as a brewer in southern Germany, Greg returned to the US to open his brewery.

Ramstein beers are made with the same care and precision that Greg learned in Germany. In fact, the wheat, barley, hops and yeast used to make Ramstein Beers are all imported directly from Bavaria.

Greg found a special brewer’s yeast used only by a small brewery in Bavaria. He was able to get the brewery to let him use the special yeast exclusively at High Point. The unique, complex character of Ramstein beers is a result of this private yeast and of course, High Point’s careful and proper brewing methods.

The name Ramstein was adopted from a town in Germany with a large American population. The town surrounds the U.S. Ramstein Air Force Base. High Point wanted the name of its beers to reflect a marriage of German tradition and American innovation.

Today High Point Brewing Company expanded beyond wheat beers and brews 11 different wheat beers and lagers.

breweries.name: Ellicottville Brewing Company
breweries.description:
To date, EBC is considered one of the finest craft brewers and has received no less than THREE International World Beer Championship Awards.

The Ellicottville Brewing Company is the result of the desire to open a family business. Inspiration struck during a ski trip to Vail, where other craft brewers began. There was the realization that Ellicottville, sometimes referred to as "the Aspen of the East", would be the perfect location for a craft brewery & grill.

After 10 years of building a successfull brewery & restaurant in Ellicottville, our team ventured to open a second location where we could build on our brewing & culinary talents. EBC West opened June 1st, 2005 in the fun-filled college town of Fredonia, home to SUNY Fredonia.

data.name: Pale Ale
data.description: Our American style Pale Ale is a hop lover's dream. We craft this copper colored ale to supply a moderate bitterness and an aggressive hop flavor and aroma. Columbus hops pitched early in the boil give a clean, soft bitterness. Late kettle hops include Northern Brewer, Simcoe, and Chinook for plenty of pungent pine and citrus character. Judicious amounts of four specialty malts add counter and depth. Expect a medium bodied brew with an assertive, complex flavor and a dry finish.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: American-Style Pale Ale
style.description: American pale ales range from deep golden to copper in color. The style is characterized by fruity, floral and citrus-like American-variety hop character producing medium to medium-high hop bitterness, flavor, and aroma. Note that the "traditional" style of this beer has its origins with certain floral, fruity, citrus-like, piney, resinous, or sulfur-like American hop varietals. One or more of these hop characters is the perceived end, but the perceived hop characters may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. American pale ales have medium body and low to medium maltiness. Low caramel character is allowable. Fruity-ester flavor and aroma should be moderate to strong. Diacetyl should be absent or present at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

breweries.name: Legend Brewing Company
breweries.description: Legend Brewing Company is a commercial microbrewery providing true premium beers to many of the best pubs and restaurants in Richmond and other areas of Virginia since January, 1994. Our mission is to bring to our customers the finest and freshest brews as flavorful alternatives to mass-marketed mainstream products. We're one of the few craft breweries in this region producing both lagers and ales, which require different yeasts and maturation conditions. All Legend beers are unpasteurized and made from only two-row and specialty barley malt, hops, water and yeast.

breweries.name: Ale House Brewing Company
breweries.description: Located in San Jose California, we founded our brewery the principle of creating high quality, low volume, hand crafted beers. Ale House Brewing will take beers back to what they are meant to be - full bodied and flavorful. All of our beers are aged on oak to enhance the flavor profile and extract some of the natural sugars found in the wood. We invite you to experience our beers!

breweries.name: John Harvard's Brew House
breweries.description:
John Harvard’s boasts and extensive list of brews, ranging from the tried and true All Amrican Light Lager to the rich, roasted Dry Irish Stout. In addition, we carry a full-line of seasonal brews, so you’re sure to find the perfect beer any time of year.

When you come to John Harvard’s, please check with your server to find out what specialty beers are available, as well. Our award winning brewers offer a range of beer styles from around the world.

data.name: Pale Ale
data.description: Our Pale Ale is a stronger version of an American-Style Pale Ale but brewed with an international blend of malts including British Maris Otter Pale Malt and specialty malts Belgian Aromatic as well as Crystal 60. It is smooth and at 7.3% alcohol by volume, this stalwart pale ale is brewed to be more robust than the standard American-Style Pale Ale.

data.name: Pale Ale
data.description: This classic American Pale Ale is floral to the nose and flavorful to the mouth.  2-Row & 5 Specialty Malts create subtle caramel tones while just the slap right amout of cascade hops make our Pale Ale just a shade short of perfect.  Grab some and tell us what you think.  Surely to be one of your favorites.

breweries.name: Good People Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Like most real brewers, Good People started out with humble beginnings and no intention of ever starting a business. A labor of love in which long brew days in the garage, bad equipment, curious dogs (we still blame them for a bad batch or two) and hanging out with friends became commonplace. Once it took root, this hobby turned into a passion (along with some really solid beers).

We took our wares to football games, parties, and cookouts. Before too long, folks began requesting our beer. It’s pretty fun to have someone you don’t even know walk right smack dab up to you and tell you how much they like your beer. We didn’t set out to start a business, the business just found us. 

“Once in a while you get shown the light in the strangest of places if you look at it right” Robert Hunter

We wanted to brew our beer and create something that would make our families, friends, community, and ourselves proud in what we were doing. We wanted to give back and help support those that helped support us.  We wanted to represent the unique qualities of the South that make us proud to be southerners. 

Good People Brewing Company seemed like the perfect fit.  Good People describes the kind, humble, concerned, and respected folks all throughout the South, no matter if your speaking singularly or plurally. That is what we strive for here at Good People Brewing Company….to be good people. 

In September of 2007, we acquired our equipment and started getting our brewery put together. It was a long, frustrating, and tiring process….but it was flat worth every bit of it all.

So if you are looking for something made in small batches with high quality ingredients and pride, please give us a shot.

The Brewery
We brew on a two kettle, combi-tank and brew kettle, 20 bbl system manufactured by New World Systems. New World is now Premier Stainless and Rob and Alan are two of the best in the business.

We have three 20 bbl fermenters and one 20 bbl bright tank.

breweries.name: Loop Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Enjoy the historic building, unique atmosphere, fresh brick oven pizza and smooth craft beer. Loop Brewing Company is the perfect place to dine with your family and friends. Share a pint of fine, handcrafted beer within sight of the very brewing tanks that produced it.

Loop Brewing Company was established in 2011 in McCook, Nebraska. The brewery is situated along the railroad tracks that shaped the town nearly 130 years ago. Loop Brewing Company pays homage to its roots through an age-old tradition of quality, handcrafted brewing. Our beer is as rich as our heritage

data.name: Pale Ale
data.description: Balanced toward the hoppy end of the spectrum, this straight-forward, dry hopped California  pale is eminently sessionable. Crystal malts provide a backbone to showcase the bright, citrus, piney notes of Cascade, Chinook, Citra, and Simcoe hops.

Saint Archer's been a long time in the tank and we hope you taste our appreciation and gratitude in every sip.

breweries.name: Czann's Brewing
breweries.description: Czann’s Brewing Company has a catalog of several ale recipes that will be available year round and seasonally. The Brew Masters overall approach to designing each beer is to strike a balance between solid malt flavor and hop bitterness. Base and most of the specialty malts are supplied by Franco-Belges, one of the largest malteries in Europe. Rather than just adding bitterness, German and American hop varieties are selected to add to the overall flavor of each beer. And finally a clean yeast strain allows the flavor contribution from each ingredient to stand out in every glass.

breweries.name: Humboldt Brewing Company
breweries.description:
In 1987 a new direction in craft beer took flight from the redwoods of Northern California, helping set the pace for the craft brew revolution. 
Founded in Humboldt County as one of California’s pioneering microbreweries, Humboldt Brewing Co. has been making waves for decades with our innovative brewing techniques and award-winning flock of delicious brews. 

We have experienced quite a journey in our 26 years. Today, we are independently owned by Total Beverage Solution and brewed on California’s Central Coast by Firestone Walker. We continue to craft the finest all-natural brews from the California Coast, giving you a taste of the Humboldt spirit in every sip.

data.name: Pale Ale
data.description: Pale Ale is a golden amber brew, made with Cascade hops from the Yakima Valley. Adding Cascades during conditioning captures the rich aroma of the hop, and completes the clean, well-balanced flavor of our American pale ale. Crisp, refreshing, exotically aromatic, and available all year.

breweries.description: Otter Creek has been hitting, hopping and dosing brews with creativity since acid-wash jeans were hip. Under the direction of brewmaster Mike Gerhart, we are undergoing a renaissance of rad, a rebirth of cool--throwing a bit of kind into the kettle whenever possible. Our hop-soaked ales are available throughout the Northeast and mid-Atlantic regions.

This American style pale uses four US  hops that give citrus character and plenty of bitterness. Try this beer with spicy Asian, a burger with the works or a chunk of stilton.

breweries.name: Hunter Beer Co
breweries.description:
What we do here at HBC is make beer, great beer, great beer that we enjoy drinking. We also have the opportunity to share our love of beer with visitors who drop by to watch us work, sample our wares or just have a chat. We make a large range of beers with a huge range of colours, aromas & flavours & we firmly believe there is a beer in there for everyone – and the only real way to find out is by visiting us and tasting the beer!
 
Our brewery is very small, one of the smallest in the country. We strive to create a beer experience for our customers. Visit the brewery, chat to a brewer, watch us at work - the person who made the beer will be pouring the beer for you to enjoy!
 
Most of our beer is sold on-site, but if you are unable to visit us our beer is available in other locations (several restaurants, pubs and bottleshops) or you can order on-line .

The brewpub is open year-round serving unique, hand-crafted dishes, fresh "honest" pints, and hand made Sno-Cap Root Beer.  Titletown's Beerworks production brewery was completed in 2014, bottling award winning beers just footsteps from the existing brewpub.

breweries.name: The ChopHouse & Brewery
breweries.description: As a popular gathering place, our pride is in serving American steakhouse classics, paired with the city’s finest handcrafted beers brewed on site. But we are much more than a steakhouse, offering a great experience at an affordable price, with hand-cut chops, fresh seafood and an extensive wine list, all in a unique turn of the century bank transformed into one of Washington’s hot spots.

breweries.name: Palmetto Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Opened by Ed Falkenstein and Louis Bruce in 1993 to create a locally-brewed alternative to domestic and import beers, Palmetto is South Carolina's oldest brewery and the first to open in the state since Prohibition. We make four year-round styles of beer, with every batch brewed in our twenty-five barrel brewing system.

Ed and Louis started making great beers after a windsurfing trip to Hood River Oregon. After finding inspiration and realizing that Charleston needed some better beer, they set up shop on Huger Street and have been brewing up trouble ever since. 

Wanna come see us?

Tasting Room hours are:
Tues-Thurs 3pm - 9pm
Fri-Sat 1pm - 10pm

data.name: Pale Ale - Cask with Mango, Amarillo, and Citra
data.nameDisplay: Pale Ale - Cask with Mango, Amarillo, and Citra
data.description: The Legend Pale Ale is already a very hoppy pale, and we’ve infused it with fresh mango. Additionally, we dry hopped our Pale with Amarillo and Citra hops (which have fruity characteristics) to compliment the mango esters. This beer is very palatable in the summer’s heat.

Diacetyl should be absent or present at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

breweries.name: Legend Brewing Company
breweries.description: Legend Brewing Company is a commercial microbrewery providing true premium beers to many of the best pubs and restaurants in Richmond and other areas of Virginia since January, 1994. Our mission is to bring to our customers the finest and freshest brews as flavorful alternatives to mass-marketed mainstream products. We're one of the few craft breweries in this region producing both lagers and ales, which require different yeasts and maturation conditions. All Legend beers are unpasteurized and made from only two-row and specialty barley malt, hops, water and yeast.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Mon - Thu:	11:30 am - 11:00 pm
Fri - Sat:	11:30 am - 12:00 am
Sun:	12:30 pm - 10:00 pm

style.name: American-Style Pale Ale
style.description: American pale ales range from deep golden to copper in color. The style is characterized by fruity, floral and citrus-like American-variety hop character producing medium to medium-high hop bitterness, flavor, and aroma. Note that the "traditional" style of this beer has its origins with certain floral, fruity, citrus-like, piney, resinous, or sulfur-like American hop varietals. One or more of these hop characters is the perceived end, but the perceived hop characters may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. American pale ales have medium body and low to medium maltiness. Low caramel character is allowable. Fruity-ester flavor and aroma should be moderate to strong. Diacetyl should be absent or present at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

breweries.description: Craft Brewery specializing in IPA's and Sours

Diacetyl should be absent or present at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

breweries.name: Uinta Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Named after the only major east-west running mountain range located in the continental U.S., Uinta Brewing Company's journey began in 1993 with the reality that passion for craft beer and a hankering for the great outdoors could align in Salt Lake City, UT.
 
Built on an axis point that endorses sustainability, community involvement and innovation, their compass guides them on a path to admirable, consistent craft beer leading consumers to discover a brand with passion, personality and soul.  Precisely, GREAT BEER is Uinta's True North.

data.name: Pale Ale 419
data.description: A perfect balance between malt and hops, this classic style uses clean American Ale yeast to enhance the character of the Cascade hops. It may or may not be named for the 419 area code.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

breweries.name: The Phoenix Brewing Company
breweries.description: The Phoenix opened in in April 2014 and features our handcrafted beers along with regional beers, wines and spirits in our restored 1914 mortuary.

breweries.name: Wiper and True
breweries.description: A Bristol based brewery. Find our beer at destinations across the country and further afield. We hope you enjoy the drinking as much as we did the brewing.

data.name: Pale Ale Turkey Edition
data.description: A stronger version of our Pale Ale made with fresh Sage, Rosemary and Thyme and dry hopped with Sorachi Ace.
